The 'Waste Framework Directive (WFD)' is a European Union Directive of 17 June
2008. Directive [2008/98/EC] of the European Parliament and of the Council
on waste. The first Waste Framework Directive dates back to 1975
(Directive 75/442/EEC) and was substantially amended in
1991. (91/156/EEC)

The aim of the WFD was to lay the basis to turn the EU into a recycling society.

One of the main features of the WFD is the European Waste Hierarchy.
